key_risks: Legal disputes with Dayco Products LLC and Gates Corporation over trade dress infringement and marketing statements
Supply chain vulnerabilities due to reliance on global manufacturing and sourcing
Economic sensitivity tied to the automotive aftermarket industry
controversies: Unfair labor practice case involving RB Distribution, Inc., a Dorman subsidiary
Customer complaints filed with the Better Business Bureau regarding product quality and online purchases
environmental_issues: Progress in sustainable packaging and energy-efficient manufacturing
social_issues: Labor relations concerns due to unfair labor practice case
Customer trust issues stemming from product quality complaints
governance_issues: Legal risks tied to competitive practices and trade disputes

sources.title: Opinions on Dorman quality, please | BobIsTheOilGuy
sources.snippet: Dorman makes almost everything in one way or another. Their quality is hit & miss, like everything else. Raybestos got out of the clutch hydraulic business a couple years ago. For the most part, the dorman clutch hydraulics and brake hydraulics have been pretty reliable. Almost everything Dorman makes is mfgr'd in China.

sources.title: This is a PSA to all techs, service writers and home-gamers ... - Reddit
sources.snippet: There are very rare occasions where the dorman part is somehow better quality than OEM, which only speaks about how bad OEM is. Last dorman part I bought was a set of parking brake cables. OE uses plastic retainers and plastic hardware on the cable. Dorman actually used metal clips and metal hardware.
